entry.title: Big News For Ripple: SEC Signals No Plans To Appeal Ruling
entry.summary:
The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has signaled it will not appeal Wednesday‚Äôs ruling by Judge Torres in the legal battle with Ripple. The case concluded on August 7 with the company facing a civil penalty significantly less than the SEC originally demanded.
Judge Torres‚Äôs decision mandated a $125 million civil penalty for securities violations related to sales to institutions, along with a disgorgement of $0. This is a stark contrast to the approximately $2 billion in damages initially sought by the SEC. Additionally, an injunction was imposed to prevent further violations of Section 5 of the Securities Act.
SEC Breaks Silence On Ripple Ruling
While Ripple‚Äôs executives immediately commented on the ruling via X, celebrating the ruling as a victory, the US agency remained‚Ä¶

entry.title: Putin Legalizes Crypto Mining, Ushering In A New Era For Russia
entry.summary:
Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed a law on Thursday, officially giving legal status for crypto mining in the country.
This historic law not only brings Russia into the global crypto economy but also sets in motion a legislative blueprint to prevent illegal activity, so ensuring the nation stays both a player and a watchdog in the digital financial scene.
New Regulations For Crypto Miners
According to multiple news outlets, the new legislation, set to go into effect this November, gives registered legal firms and individual entrepreneurs exclusive rights to mine cryptocurrencies in an attempt to balance innovation and control.
There is, however, a break for the small players: people who stay within certain government-set energy consumption limits can mine without having ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Montenegro‚Äôs Supreme Court Halts Do Kwon‚Äôs Homecoming To South Korea Again ‚Äì Details
entry.summary:
The Supreme Court of Montenegro has postponed the extradition of Terraform Labs founder Do Kwon to his home country of South Korea, pending a review of the legality of the previous court decisions.¬†
This comes after the Supreme State Prosecutor‚Äôs Office (VDT) submitted a request to protect legality on August 2nd, proposing to delay the execution of the extradition orders issued by the High Court in Podgorica and the Court of Appeal.
Conflicting Rulings Plague Do Kwon Extradition Saga¬†
According to local media reports, the panel, headed by Judge Seka Piletiƒá, made the ruling in response to a request from the VDT, which raised concerns about whether the court‚Äôs previous decisions approving Do Kwon‚Äôs extradition to South Korea and rejecting his extradition to the United States were lega‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Exchange WazirX To Restore User Balances Following $230 Million Hack
entry.summary:
On Thursday, Indian crypto exchange WazirX announced its plan to compensate customers after the multi-million exploit it suffered last month. The exchange revealed it decided to restore the balances of all customers and undo all trades carried out before July 18 and July 21.
WazirX To Restore All Account Balances
On July 18, WazirX fell victim to a security breach that took approximately $235 million from one of the trading platforms‚Äô multisig wallets. The crypto heist stole millions of ETH, SHIB, PEPE, MATIC, and other tokens, leaving thousands of users empty-handed.
As a result, the platform halted operations and set into motion a plan to recover the stolen funds. The bounty program designated 10% of the stolen funds, around $23 million, to those who assisted WazirX‚Äôs team in rec‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Story of Solana Meme Coin Billy
entry.summary: Billy is the largest Solana meme coin on Pumpdotfun, peaking at a market cap of over $200 million. But it wasn‚Äôt always smooth sailing. Minutes after launching Billy‚Äôs dev abandoned him and sold the majority of their tokens. At the time, the tokens were worth $1,116 but at today‚Äôs value they‚Äôd be worth more than $8.65 million.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Do Crypto Degens Care About Being Scammed?
entry.summary: What's the Meta? With the rise of Pumpdotfun and rug pulls becoming a daily occurrence, why do crypto degens keep investing? Do these investors enjoy being scammed? It appears that people very often invest in meme coins that are very obviously going to rug pull. Once it happens, they just laugh it off on Twitter, is being scammed fun?!
